VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Compensation relative to the peak of Remote Work Options in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Compensation is to the {left} of the peak of Remote Work Options.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Remote Work Options show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Remote Work Options shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Work-Life Balance} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =78.8?
EVJ.A: At X =78.8,the label with the highest density is {Company Culture}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 59? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Company Culture}'s peak at {83},{Job Security}'s peak at {79}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 71? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Career Growth}'s peak at {32},{Work-Life Balance}'s peak at {10},{Compensation}'s peak at {9},{Remote Work Options}'s peak at {15}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Work-Life Balance or Compensation?
NC.A: {Work-Life Balance} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Career Growth or Compensation?
NC.A: {Career Growth} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Work-Life Balance or Job Security?
NC.A: {Job Security} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Compensation or Work-Life Balance?
NC.A: {Work-Life Balance} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Work-Life Balance}
